article: I believe the best heroes are often the ones who haven't been publicly recognized. They're someone's hero just by living their life as  _  , not necessarily struggling for anything particular outside of survival. They're everyday ordinary people.  _  , my greatest hero without doubt isn't a famous person or someone who has a rags-to-riches story. In fact, this person isn't a  _  at all, but a heroine: my mother, who has been my greatest source of inspiration . A brief glance into this  _  woman's life makes it clear. My mother was married to a man who drank like a fish almost every day. As Mother  _  o us later in life, she simply didn't want us to be  _  by my father. So, one day she packed her seven kids into an old wagon , and headed back down south to Montgomery, Alabama. At five foot three, she was a black lady with a small figure, with no college education. She did whatever she had to do to  _  as a single parent and to successfully  _  all her children to adulthood. By high school I had started to  _  my mother had achieved something  _  as a single parent. Then, when I was seventeen years old, I signed up for the Marine Corps. The day I  _  for basic training, my mother told me, a very thin and nervous black kid, four  _  words: "Just do your best." That  _  may be a cliche , but coming from her , it has given me a lifetime of powerful inspiration. I've had my  _  of ups and downs in my life. Whenever meeting with any difficulty, I would  _  to myself, "If Mother overcame her challenges, I have no  _  not to do the same."  _  I grew, I admired her for what she had achieved. I graduated from community college with highest  _  , and now I'm a student at Columbia University. Every step of the  _  , I've been encouraged by the inspiration of my mother -- my heroine. I've never  _  . I've tried to do my best.
